title: Calories in Tequila (Per Shot)
meta_description: Learn calories in tequila for a standard 1.5 oz shot, including full nutrition facts, equivalents, and tweaks for cocktails or proof variations.
assumptions: 80-proof (40% ABV) tequila, straight shot of 1.5 fl oz (44 ml), no mixers, limes, or salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any additions like mixers; distilled spirits have minimal non-alcohol nutrients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof tequila contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels, though alcohol content is the primary energy source with negligible macros.

tweaks.label: In a simple margarita (with 1 oz lime juice and 0.5 oz triple sec)

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of tequila?
faqs.a: About 97 calories for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof tequila.

faqs.q: Does tequila have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No, pure tequila has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: Calories in tequila vs other spirits?
faqs.a: Similar to vodka or gin at ~97 kcal per 1.5 oz shot for 80-proof; varies slightly by type.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in tequila?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories—100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot compared to 80-proof.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in tequila besides calories?
faqs.a: Minimal; 0 g protein, fat, fiber, and trace sodium only—no significant vitamins or minerals.
